alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 10:52PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FRANKLIN COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA, WAYNE AND UNION COUNTIES IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA, NORTHEASTERN DEARBORN COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA, FAYETTE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL INDIANA, NORTHERN BOONE COUNTY IN NORTHERN KENTUCKY, NORTHWESTERN HAMILTON COUNTY IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO, PREBLE COUNTY IN WEST CENTRAL OHIO AND BUTLER COUNTIES IN SOUTHWESTERN OHIO THROUGH 1145 PM EDT... At 1052 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Brookville, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Hamilton, Fairfield, Richmond, Oxford, Forest Park, Connersville, Harrison, North College Hill, Eaton, Cheviot, Mount Healthy, Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Brookville, Centerville, Cambridge City, Bright and Hidden Valley. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Indiana between mile markers 134 and 156. I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 13. I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 160 and 171. I-74 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 18. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
